text_2.eng:
1️⃣ Ensure attendance register, name tags, temporary adhesive, pens, paper, flipchart, markers, toys and props, stickers, and refreshments for the break are ready. 
2️⃣ Set up the room with chairs in a circle. 

3️⃣ List all participant goals on flipchart paper ahead of time.

4️⃣ Prepare the laptop, LCD projector, and screen for showing the illustrated stories.

rows.text_2:
1️⃣ Ensure attendance register, name tags, temporary adhesive, pens, paper, flipchart, markers, toys and props, stickers, and refreshments for the break are ready. 
2️⃣ Set up the room with chairs in a circle. 

3️⃣ List all participant goals on flipchart paper ahead of time.

4️⃣ Prepare the laptop, LCD projector, and screen for showing the illustrated stories.

text_2.eng:
**WELCOME (15 minutes)**
- Begin by welcoming the participants.
- Do a Name Game to help everyone get to know each other.
- Remind the group of the programme structure and content.
- Lead a short physical exercise to energize the group.
- Review the ground rules for the session.

**OVERVIEW (30 minutes)**
- Reminder of programme structure and content 
- Ground rules 
- Parent goals

**BREAK (15 min)**

**CORE LESSON: Parenting Skill – One-on-One Time (50 minutes)**
- Video Story 1 and role-play the scenario together as a big group.
- Video Story 2 and do another big group role-play.
- Discuss the benefits of spending One-on-One Time with your child.
- Brainstorm activities caregivers can do with their children during One-on-One Time.
- Practice One-on-One Time in pairs.
- Review tips for making One-on-One Time effective and enjoyable.


**HOME ACTIVITIES & CLOSING (10 minutes)**
Caregivers are encouraged to:
- Have a conversation with their child about the goals identified in the session.
- Spend at least 5 minutes each day in One-on-One Time with their child.
- Take a Pause whenever feeling stressed or upset.
- Do the Physical Exercise every morning after waking up.
For closing: 
- Review the core topics covered in the session.
- Inform caregivers about the text messages they will receive.
- Remind them about the next online session and the home activities.
- Thank and praise all participants for their contributions.

text_2.eng: Have a group discussion about sharing goals that are positive, specific, and realistic.

rows.text_2: Have a group discussion about sharing goals that are positive, specific, and realistic.

rows.text_1: **CORE LESSON: Parenting Skill – One-on-One Time (50 minutes)**

text_1.eng: **CORE LESSON: Parenting Skill – One-on-One Time (50 minutes)**

text_2.eng:
You may want to close your eyes and sit comfortably while you listen to this message.

Take a moment to think about what your lives and children were like before the programme began.

Now think about each of the parts of the ParentChat programme:

Spending One-on-One time with your child

Talking about feelings

Keeping it positive with praise and instructions

Involving your children in making household rules and daily routines

Using positive discipline like redirect and consequences

Involving your children in solving problems

Think about how the things you learned during the programme were different from the way you interacted with your children before the programme.

Think about how you have changed, how your relationship to your children has changed, and how your children’s behaviours have changed.

When you are ready, you can open your eyes.

Take a moment to think about what your lives and children were like before the programme began.

Talking about feelings

Keeping it positive with praise and instructions

Involving your children in making household rules and daily routines

Using positive discipline like redirect and consequences

Involving your children in solving problems

Think about how the things you learned during the programme were different from the way you interacted with your children before the programme.

Think about how you have changed, how your relationship to your children has changed, and how your children’s behaviours have changed.

When you are ready, you can open your eyes.

rows.text_1: At this stage, please introduce the new administrator of the group. If time permits, suggest that the group make a concrete plan about when they would next like to meet.

text_1.eng: At this stage, please introduce the new administrator of the group. If time permits, suggest that the group make a concrete plan about when they would next like to meet.
